activities:
Personal data provided by users of Zynga's social gaming applications and websites. Zynga collects personal information such as account registration information, profile information, technical information (e.g., IP Address, device identifiers), and geo-location information. Zynga uses this information to provide the service, including allowing users to connect with their friends, track installs, target advertising, and deliver notifications on game events and new products and features.

Human Resources data from EU subsidiaries.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: online user data; online and offline HR data; online and offline vendor/supplier data
recoursemech:
TRUSTe for user data.

European Union Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) for HR data
